sourceDesc.p: M.R. James, Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge 1912

projectDesc.p: The James Catalogue was digitized then marked up following the TEI P5 Guidelines. The customized model was provided by Giuliano Di Bacco, stored in an ODD file (parkerweb.xml): the latter was written by GDB using ROMA vers. 2.x, with manual adaptations. The ODD file is used as a source to compile the actual schema used to validate the xml: it is advisable to compile it in RelaxNG sintax (parkerweb.rnc) through ROMA.

msDesc.head: Adam of Barking, Carmen de serie sex aetatum
Adam of Barking
msDesc.p: Vellum, 270 110 10.6 x 4.5, ff. 1 + 141, 56-60 lines to a page. Cent. xii-xiii, in more than one very neat hand.
Quires 5-8 have an old numbering I-IIII.
On the flyleaf (f. iv) Bale's account of Adamus Barkingensis.
Leland (Collectanea IV 150) saw a copy of this work at Sherborne, which may be the one before us.

msItem.head: Adam of Barking, Carmen de serie sex aetatum
msItem.ab: It begins
msItem.rubric: Auctor huius operis de sex etatum serie tractare proponens breuiterque concludere que leuiter transierunt carptim tangit in prologo precedenti de quibus latius est tractaturus in opere subsequenti dicens se otio iam diu deditum torpore deposito iam ad studia reuersum se de magnis breuiter tractaturum promittens et unde tractaturus hec (hic?) seriatim capitula premittens

lg.l: Scribere decreui decursum labilis eui
Claudere fine breui fine peracta leui
Que lux leticie . quis sit fons philosophie
Quid caput ecclesie . que uia . duxque uie
Tempora patris ade renouante stilo mihi trade
Musa stilo trade tempora patris ade

msItem.ab: The story of the Creation is begun on f. 3v
msItem.rubric: Auctor huius operis a summo omnium auctore deo narrationis seriem inchoans etc.

lg.l: Ante creaturas tot secula totque figuras
Tot generum formas tantas per tot loca normas

msItem.ab: On f. 15r the Flood is reached. Here is a gap. After 12 lines, ending

lg.l: Nil alibi tutum nihil est a morte solutum
Nulla foris tuta morti sunt queque tributa,

msItem.ab: the rest of the page is blank
a.

lg.l: Nuper eram locup(l)es multisque beatus amicis
Et risere mihi fata secunda diu

msItem.ab: (Hildebert P. L. CLXXI 1418)

lg.l: Ille potens mitis tenor et concordia rerum
Quicquid uult in me digerat. eius ero

msItem.ab: b.

lg.l: Si supplex hominum tibi seruiat ordo. quid inde
Tam cito pretereunt hec omnia quod nihil inde

msItem.ab: (6 lines)
c.

lg.l: Ridentis iocus est fortune copia rerum
Mobilis hec nescit continuare iocum
Ergo cum proles mihi sit bona. non nihil inde
Nam sine prole pater est sine sole dies

msItem.ab: (24 lines)
Rest of 16v blank

lg.l: Hiis interiectis uti decet amodo rectis
Ad seriem recti recto decet ordine flecti

msItem.ab: with a sign referring to a passage on f. 75v
Story of Abraham begins f. 21r
On f. 38r is a break and reference to a passage which occurs on f. 80v
On f. 38v a fresh beginning

lg.l: Dum uigil inquiro de lacte simulque butiro

msItem.ab: which only occupies this page

On f. 39r change of hand and entirely new exordium: a very long address to Christ for all estates of men On f. 47v-48r in a prayer for kings is a disquisition on the meaning of the several Regal ornaments, and a still longer disquisition on the Incarnation, the Virgin, and the types referring thereto

lg.l: Ad titulum Christi titulo nota competit isti

msItem.ab: Quire 9, ff. 72r-75v, in the first hand, is an insertion containing various supplements
From f. 92r onwards we have a very full treatment of the story of Genesis from Gen. xviii to the end
On f. 134r sqq. a much shorter account of the Plagues, Exodus, the Law, the Priestly vestments
Ending (after a few lines about David)

lg.l: Sunt modo cras ut heri nequeunt diuina moueri
Sic manet immotum manet immutabile totum

msItem.ab: The work is unfinished: only four ages out of the six have been treated. The confused state of the work suggests that this copy may be the author's autograph
On f. 141v, in another hand, after 3 erased lines

lg.l: Manducare potes formicam si capud aufers
In cruce sum pro te qui peccas desine pro me
Desine do veniam do vitam corrige culpam

recordHist.p: markupCheck: checked by SP, BA, CF
